cleaned_text: LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF IDAHO Sixty-sixth Legislature Second Regular Session - 2022 IN THE SENATE SENATE BILL NO. 1330 BY HEALTH AND WELFARE COMMITTEE AN ACT 1 RELATING TO NATUROPATHIC DOCTOR LICENSING AND NATUROPATH REGISTRATION; 2 AMENDING TITLE 54, IDAHO CODE, BY THE ADDITION OF A NEW CHAPTER 59, TI - 3 TLE 54, IDAHO CODE, TO DECLARE POLICY, TO DEFINE TERMS, TO PROVIDE FOR 4 THE CREATION OF A BOARD OF NATUROPATHIC HEALTH CARE, TO PROVIDE FOR 5 BOARD DUTIES AND POWERS, TO PROVIDE FOR VOLUNTARY NATUROPATHIC DOCTOR 6 LICENSURE, TO ESTABLISH A SCOPE OF PRACTICE, TO PROVIDE FOR CERTAIN PRE - 7 SCRIPTIVE RIGHTS, TO PROVIDE FOR REGISTRATION, TO PROVIDE FOR ISSUANCE 8 AND REVOCATION OF LICENSES AND REGISTRATIONS, TO PROVIDE CERTAIN IMMU - 9 NITY, TO PROVIDE FOR PUBLIC HEALTH LAWS, AND TO ESTABLISH A FORMULARY 10 COMMITTEE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY AND PROVIDING AN EFFECTIVE DATE. 1 1 Be It Enacted by the Legislature of the State of Idaho: 12 SECTION 1. That Title 54, Idaho Code, be, and the same is hereby amended 13 by the addition thereto of a NEW CHAPTER , to be known and designated as Chap - 14 ter 59, Title 54, Idaho Code, and to read as follows: 15 CHAPTER 59 16 NATUROPATHIC DOCTOR LICENSING AND NATUROPATH REGISTRATION 17 54 - 5901. DECLARATION OF POLICY. (1) The legislature finds and de - 18 clares that the licensing of naturopathic doctors and the registration of 19 lay naturopaths will improve access to natural health care for Idahoans and 20 promote the health of all Idahoans, including the underserved population. 21 The licensing of naturopathic doctors and registration of lay naturopaths 22 will promote the public health interest by aiding in the delivery of naturo - 23 pathic medical services of high quality to the people of Idaho. To fulfill 24 these purposes, this chapter provides for the optional licensure of naturo - 25 pathic doctors as well as for the optional registration of laypersons who are 26 naturopaths. 27 (2) This chapter shall not restrict unlicensed practice lawfully pro - 28 vided pursuant to section 54 - 1804(1), Idaho Code. 29 54 - 5902. DEFINITIONS. As used in this chapter: 30 (1) "Board" means the Idaho board of naturopathic health care. 31 (2) "License" means a license to practice as a licensed naturopathic 32 doctor. 33 (3) "Licensed naturopathic doctor" means an individual licensed as a 34 medical doctor, doctor of osteopathy, doctor of podiatric medicine, natur - 35 opathic medical doctor, doctor of chiropractic, doctor of dental medicine, 36 or doctor of nursing practice who has obtained an approved naturopathic doc - 37 toral degree, as set forth in rule, and who voluntarily elects to seek and re - 38 ceives licensure under this chapter to practice naturopathic health care in 39 Idaho. 40 2 (4) "Minor procedure" means the use of operative, electrical, or other 1 methods for repair and care incidental to superficial lacerations, abra - 2 sions, superficial lesions, the removal of foreign bodies located in the 3 superficial tissues, and the use of antiseptics and local topical anesthet - 4 ics in connection with such methods. 5 (5) "Naturopathic health care" means the delivery of a distinct pri - 6 mary health care emphasizing prevention, treatment, and optimal health us - 7 ing therapeutic methods and substances that encourage an individual's in - 8 herent self - healing process by a naturopathic practitioner. 9 54 - 5903. BOARD OF NATUROPATHIC HEALTH CARE CREATED - - MEMBER APPOINT - 10 MENT - - TERMS. (1) The Idaho board of naturopathic health care is hereby cre - 1 1 ated in the division of occupational and professional licenses. The board 12 shall consist of five (5) members. For the initial board, one (1) member 13 shall be a public member, one (1) member shall be either a doctor of osteopa - 14 thy or a doctor of medicine, two (2) members shall be license - eligible natur - 15 opathic doctors, and one (1) member shall be a registered naturopath pur - 16 suant to section 54 - 5908, Idaho Code. 17 (2) The governor shall appoint the initial members of the board. Of the 18 initial members, two (2) shall be appointed for four (4) year terms and three 19 (3) shall be appointed for three (3) year terms. After the initial appoint - 20 ments, all terms of appointment shall be four (4) years. Each member shall 21 serve until a successor is appointed and qualified. No member shall serve 22 more than two (2) consecutive full terms. 23 (3) All appointments after July 1, 2028, shall maintain the following 24 criteria: one (1) public member, one (1) member who is either a doctor of 25 osteopathy or a medical doctor, two (2) members who are license - eligible 26 naturopathic doctors as set forth in section 54 - 5902(3), Idaho Code, and one 27 (1) member who is a registration - eligible naturopath as set forth in section 28 54 - 5908, Idaho Code. All appointments to the board after July 1, 2028, shall 29 be appointed by the governor. 30 (4) The board shall, within thirty (30) days after its appointment, and 31 at least annually thereafter, hold a meeting and elect a chair and a vice 32 chair and may hold additional meetings at the call of the chair or at the 33 written request of any two (2) members of the board. A majority of the board 34 shall constitute a quorum. The vote of a majority of members present at a 35 meeting wherein a quorum is present shall determine the action of the board. 36 The chair and vice chair shall each serve for a two (2) year term. No chair or 37 vice chair may serve more than two (2) consecutive terms. 38 (5) In the event of the death, resignation, or removal of any board mem - 39 ber before the expiration of the term to which he is appointed, the vacancy 40 shall be filled for the unexpired portion of the term in the same manner as 41 the original appointment. 42 (6) Board members shall serve at the pleasure of the governor. 43 (7) Each member of the board shall be compensated as provided in section 44 59 - 509(p), Idaho Code. 45 54 - 5904. BOARD DUTIES AND POWERS. The board shall have the authority 46 and the responsibility to: 47 3 (1) By July 1, 2023, and in accordance with the American naturopathic 1 medical certification board as the primary resource, determine the qualifi - 2 cations needed by each person applying for licensure pursuant to this chap - 3 ter and, in addition to the requirements of this chapter, define by rule the 4 appropriate scope of practice for each individual seeking licensure; pro - 5 vided, however, the board may only authorize a scope of practice on an indi - 6 vidual basis for each individual seeking licensure. The board shall modify 7 the authorized scope of practice based on an individual's prior and current 8 education, training, and experience. 9 (2) Consult with the American naturopathic medical certification board 10 to define and set by rule any additional qualifications for licensure. Any 1 1 such qualifications shall be in addition to those required by this chapter on 12 July 1, 2022. 13 (3) Authorize prescriptive rights or surgical authority only for an 14 applicant who demonstrates sufficient education and training in accordance 15 with an active license pursuant to section 54 - 5905(1), Idaho Code. Notwith - 16 standing this subsection, all licensees shall be permitted by the board to 17 practice according to the scope of practice pursuant to section 54 - 5906, 18 Idaho Code. 19 (4) Establish, pursuant to chapter 52, title 67, Idaho Code, any such 20 rules as are necessary for the administration of this chapter, including but 21 not limited to rules pertaining to discipline, continuing education, and 22 standards for professional conduct that reflect current practice standards 23 and promote inclusion of evidence - based innovations and advances in naturo - 24 pathic health care. 25 (5) Conduct investigations and examinations and hold hearings. 26 (6) Collect fees and other funds as authorized by this chapter. All 27 fees received under the provisions of this chapter shall be paid to the di - 28 vision of occupational and professional licenses and deposited in the state 29 treasury to the credit of the occupational licenses fund, and all costs and 30 expenses incurred under the provisions of this chapter shall be a charge 31 against and paid from said fund. 32 (7) Be responsible for legal proceedings, including those regarding 33 contracts and litigation. 34 (8) Provide such other services and perform such other functions as are 35 necessary and desirable to fulfill its purposes. 36 (9) Establish rules that provide for naturopaths to legally practice in 37 Idaho through registration rather than licensure. In order to protect pub - 38 lic health, the scope of practice for a registered naturopath shall be as 39 provided for in section 54 - 1804(1), Idaho Code. 40 (a) The board shall establish a method of registration and a reasonable 41 fee for registration and collect such fee for registration. 42 (b) No registration shall be granted until the board has approved a rea - 43 sonable fee and a method of collecting such fee for registration. 44 54 - 5905. VOLUNTARY NATUROPATHIC DOCTOR LICENSURE - - REQUIREMENTS - - 45 LIMITATIONS. (1) An applicant shall be qualified for voluntary licensure as 46 a naturopathic doctor pursuant to this chapter if such applicant: 47 4 (a) Possesses current, valid, and unrestricted licensure in another 1 state, district, or territory of the United States in at least one (1) of 2 the following medical professions: 3 (i) Medical doctor or doctor of osteopathy; 4 (ii) Podiatrist; 5 (iii) Doctor of naturopathic medicine; 6 (iv) Dentist; 7 (v) Chiropractor, if such applicant possesses an accredited 8 doctoral degree in chiropractic medicine as required pursuant to 9 chapter 7, title 54, Idaho Code; or 10 (vi) Nurse, if such applicant possess a level of training and ed - 1 1 ucation equivalent to an advanced practice registered nurse pur - 12 suant to chapter 14, title 54, Idaho Code, and has achieved an ac - 13 credited doctorate degree in nursing; 14 (b) Has a valid doctoral degree in naturopathy as approved by the board 15 from an institution accredited by the United States department of edu - 16 cation; 17 (c) Has not pled guilty to or been convicted of a crime that is deemed 18 relevant in accordance with section 67 - 9411(1), Idaho Code, unless such 19 applicant demonstrates that he has been sufficiently rehabilitated to 20 warrant the public trust; and 21 (d) Completes any one (1) of the following: 22 (i) Two (2) years of experience acceptable to the board, one (1) 23 year of which may include predoctoral practicum or internship and 24 one (1) year of which must be postdoctoral; 25 (ii) Passage of an Idaho state examination proving minimum com - 26 petency and skills, to be developed and approved by the board and 27 the American naturopathic medical certification board pursuant to 28 this chapter; or 29 (iii) Passage of any accredited national board examination that 30 certifies the individual has achieved minimum competency and 31 skills in the practice of naturopathic healthcare. 32 (2) A license issued under this chapter shall: 33 (a) Be issued in the name of the licensed naturopathic doctor; 34 (b) State the issue and expiration date; and 35 (c) Always be displayed in a conspicuous manner in the place of business 36 or employment of the licensee. 37 (3) A licensed naturopathic doctor may use the title "licensed doctor 38 of natural health" or "licensed naturopathic practitioner." A provisional 39 license shall be issued by the board until the board has finalized and ap - 40 proved licensure requirements as provided by this chapter and by rule. 41 (4) All applications for licensing shall be reviewed and approved by 42 the board on an individual basis. 43 (5) A person who is not licensed pursuant to this chapter shall not: 44 (a) Hold himself out as a naturopathic doctor licensed under this chap - 45 ter; 46 (b) Use or advertise using the title of licensed naturopathic doc - 47 tor (LND), licensed naturopathic practitioner (LNP), or any variant 48 thereof; or 49 5 (c) Use any words, abbreviations, figures, configuration of letters, 1 titles, signs, cards, or devices tending to imply that the person is a 2 naturopathic doctor licensed in the state of Idaho. 3 54 - 5906. LICENSED NATUROPATHIC DOCTORS - - SCOPE OF PRACTICE. (1) Any 4 naturopathic doctor licensed pursuant to this chapter who does not possess a 5 current, valid, and unrestricted license to practice as a physician pursuant 6 to chapter 18, title 54, Idaho Code, may engage only in the scope of practice 7 provided for in this section. 8 (2) Unless otherwise provided for in this chapter, a licensed naturo - 9 pathic doctor shall not be authorized to incorporate any rights or scope of 10 practice pursuant to licensure held in another state, district, or territory 1 1 of the United States into Idaho practice as a licensed naturopathic doctor 12 pursuant to this chapter. 13 (3) If a licensed naturopathic doctor receives licensure in Idaho to 14 practice any profession outlined in section 54 - 5905, Idaho Code, then the 15 board may allow the licensed naturopathic doctor to incorporate any addi - 16 tional scope of practice provided for in this section or prescriptive rights 17 as provided for in section 54 - 5907, Idaho Code. However, the board shall not 18 approve an expanded scope of practice pursuant to this subsection if such ad - 19 ditional licensure does not authorize such scope of practice. 20 (4) The scope of practice for a licensed naturopathic doctor shall be 21 established by rule of the board and shall include the following: 22 (a) Diagnosis and treatment of conditions affecting the human body, in - 23 cluding vitamins, minerals, or other natural methods; 24 (b) Diagnosis and care of patients using a system of practice that bases 25 treatment of physiological functions and abnormal conditions on natu - 26 ral laws governing the human body, including utilizing physiological, 27 psychological, and mechanical methods, electromagnetism, therapeutic 28 tions, neurofeedback, natural methods and substances that support hor - 31 monal and cellular health, phytotherapy, and food and herb therapies; 32 (c) Physical examination procedures and laboratory procedures, in - 33 cluding ordering imaging and diagnostic tests for purposes of diagno - 34 sis; and 35 (d) Other practices that may be allowed pursuant to the rules of the 36 board. 37 (5) Minor procedures using local anesthetics may be performed only if a 38 licensed naturopathic doctor has had postgraduate surgical training in res - 39 idency, possesses relevant board certification, and is expressly authorized 40 by the board to perform minor procedures. 41 (6) No licensed naturopathic doctor shall perform minor procedures, 42 prescribe legend drugs, or perform any other action unless otherwise ex - 43 pressly authorized by this chapter or pursuant to the rules of the board. 44 54 - 5907. PRESCRIPTIVE RIGHTS. (1) Licensed naturopathic doctors may 45 be granted certain prescriptive rights as part of their scope of practice. 46 However, prescriptive rights for licensed naturopathic doctors shall be 47 granted and maintained only if the licensed naturopathic doctor: 48 6 (a) Currently possesses and maintains a full federal drug enforcement 1 agency (DEA) registration that is in good standing prior to seeking pre - 2 scriptive rights under this license; and 3 (b) Has completed at least forty - five (45) credit hours of pharmacology 4 from an institution accredited by the United States department of edu - 5 cation. 6 (2) Licensed naturopathic doctors' individual prescriptive rights 7 pursuant to this section shall be limited to all medications, treatments, or 8 any other item to be prescribed that are outlined and approved by the board. 9 However, the board shall not approve any medication, treatment, or any other 10 similar item that is not approved by the formulary committee. 1 1 (3) This section shall not and is not intended to authorize group licen - 12 sure for all individuals licensed under this chapter. Each licensed naturo - 13 pathic doctor must, on an individual basis, receive approval from the board 14 to prescribe as a licensed naturopathic doctor. 15 (4) The board, by rule, shall ensure that any approval of a licensed 16 naturopathic doctor's request to prescribe as a licensed naturopathic doc - 17 tor does not exceed the prescriptive scope the licensed naturopathic doctor 18 previously possessed prior to licensure under this chapter. 19 54 - 5908. REGISTERED NATUROPATHS. (1) Naturopaths who are not licensed 20 naturopathic doctors may, but shall not be required to, obtain registration 21 under the provisions of this chapter and pursuant to the rules of the board. 22 (2) The scope of practice for a registered naturopath under this chap - 23 ter shall be limited to practices permitted pursuant to section 54 - 1804(1), 24 Idaho Code. 25 54 - 5909. LICENSE AND REGISTRATION ISSUANCE, REVOCATION, AND RE - 26 NEWAL. (1) The board shall issue and renew licenses or issue and renew 27 registrations to persons who have qualified therefor in accordance with the 28 provisions of this chapter. 29 (2) The board shall refuse licensure or registration to, revoke the li - 30 cense or registration of, or place restrictions on the licensee or regis - 31 trant if such person: 32 (a) Is a current health care professional whose licensure is or pre - 33 viously has been revoked, suspended, placed on probation, reprimanded, 34 limited, restricted, or conditioned, or if such person has been or is 35 currently subject to disciplinary action with respect to professional 36 licensure; 37 (b) Engages in conduct prohibited by this chapter; 38 (c) Obtains or attempts to obtain the issuance or renewal of a license 39 or registration pursuant to this chapter by means of fraud, misrepre - 40 sentation, or concealment of material facts; 41 (d) Has at any time failed to maintain the confidentiality of records or 42 other information pertaining to an identifiable client, except as re - 43 quired or authorized by law; 44 (e) Engages in any conduct that constitutes an abuse or exploitation of 45 a client arising out of the trust and confidence placed in the licensed 46 naturopathic doctor or registered naturopath by the client; 47 7 (f) Fails to, or has previously failed to, adhere to generally accepted 1 standards pursuant to section 54 - 1804, Idaho Code; 2 (g) Is convicted of, or in the past was convicted of, a crime deemed rel - 3 evant in accordance with section 67 - 9411(1), Idaho Code; 4 (h) Engages in conduct that violates the provisions of this chapter, 5 the rules of the board, or the terms of any license or registration is - 6 sued by the board; or 7 (i) Fails to comply with a board order entered in any disciplinary mat - 8 ter. 9 (3) In making a determination under subsection (2) of this section, the 10 board shall take into consideration the rehabilitation of the applicant and 1 1 other mitigating circumstances. 12 (4) An applicant for a license or registration under this chapter shall 13 submit any fee established pursuant to board rules. 14 (5) All licenses issued under the provisions of this chapter shall be 15 subject to annual or biennial renewal and shall expire unless renewed in the 16 manner prescribed by the board. License renewal and reinstatement shall be 17 in accordance with section 67 - 2614, Idaho Code. 18 54 - 5910. IMMUNITY OF BOARD MEMBERS AND PERSONS REPORTING INFORMATION 19 TO BOARD. Any member or agent of the board, any member who has served on the 20 board, or any person under oath shall not be subject to a civil action for 21 damages as a result of reporting information in good faith, without fraud 22 or malice, relating to alleged violations or vindictive violations of this 23 chapter or board rules. 24 54 - 5911. OBSERVATION OF PUBLIC HEALTH LAW. Each individual licensed 25 or registered under this chapter shall observe and be subject to all state, 26 federal, and municipal regulations relating to the control of contagious and 27 infectious diseases, reporting and certifying deaths, and all matters per - 28 taining to public health. Failure to comply with these requirements shall 29 constitute grounds for disciplinary action pursuant to the provisions of 30 this chapter and the laws of the state of Idaho. 31 54 - 5912. FORMULARY COMMITTEE. (1) The board shall appoint a formulary 32 committee consisting of one (1) member who is licensed to practice in Idaho 33 as a pharmacist (PharmD), one (1) member who is either a doctor of osteopa - 34 thy or a doctor of medicine, and three (3) members who are either eligible to 35 receive licensure and possess full federal drug enforcement registration in 36 good standing under this chapter or have received licensure under this chap - 37 ter and possess full federal drug enforcement registration and prescriptive 38 rights. 39 (2) All members of the formulary committee shall possess a valid and ac - 40 tive federal drug enforcement agency number and be authorized to prescribe 41 within the United States. 42 (3) Initially, three (3) members shall serve for three (3) years and two 43 (2) members shall serve for two (2) years. After the initial appointments, 44 all terms of appointment shall be three (3) years. No member may serve for 45 more than two (2) consecutive terms. 46 8 (4) The formulary committee shall act in an advisory role in evaluating 1 prescriptive authority for applicants or other similar issues as called upon 2 by the board. However, the formulary committee shall first approve the scope 3 of prescriptive rights that individuals licensed under this chapter may use 4 before the board approves the scope of prescriptive rights. 5 SECTION 2. An emergency existing therefor, which emergency is hereby 6 declared to exist, this act shall be in full force and effect on and after 7 July 1, 2022. 8
